title: Sr. Structural Analysis Engineer

pay_input_ranges.title: The pay range for this position is:
pay_input_ranges.blurb: Base pay offered may vary depending on skills, experience, job-related knowledge and location. This position is also eligible for a bonus as part of total compensation.

content:
Supernal is at the forefront of creating emerging mobility solutions that will foster the development of human-centered cities. We are designing a completely new electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) aircraft tailored to the mobility needs of future cities. This allows passengers a seamless intermodal journey that safely transports them to their final destination. We fuse research in autonomy, robotics, aviation and services to define a new category of mobility for the world’s communities. We believe in creative thinking and collaboration to help build a better mobility experience for everyone, improving people’s ability to move – whether for work or play.
What we do: 
The Sr. Structural Analysis Engineer performs stress analysis of metallic and composite primary aircraft structure made from cutting-edge composite materials and technologies. Our Airframe Structural Analysis & Test team is responsible for performing analysis of airframe structures and work closely with Structural Design, Loads, Payloads/Interiors, Material & Process, Manufacturing Technology, System and Test & Evaluation groups. This role helps build our structural analysis capabilities from the ground up and provides technical solutions for the Airframe Structural Analysis team.
This position will be required to work on-site 5 days a week.
What you can do:

Perform structural analysis of aerospace primary and secondary structures made of composite and metallic materials for experimental and type certificated vehicles
Apply free body diagrams, hand calculations and numerical methods for estimating and developing loads
Develop and apply analysis methods for static strength, stability, durability, and damage tolerance
Work closely with design and test engineers to determine test requirements and support vehicle and sub-scale tests
Work independently or with minimum supervision to come up with conceptual and detailed analysis based on the requirements
Coach, mentor, and develop others on the Stress and Airframe teams on technical topics
Guide development of new manufacturing technologies, engineering tools, and aircraft structural designs
May require up to 10% of domestic and international travel
Other duties as assigned

What you can contribute:

Bachelor’s degree required in mechanical, aerospace, aeronautical or equivalent disciplines; Master’s degree preferred
Minimum five (5) years of experience working with fixed- or rotary-wing aircraft structure strength, stability, fatigue analysis and/or finite element analysis
Minimum four (4) years of experience with composites structures
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
Must have the ability to independently prioritize and accomplish work within time constraints

You may also be able to contribute:

Familiarity with industry level composite activities (e.g. NCAMP, CMH17 or P17) preferred
Familiarity with durability and damage tolerance analysis techniques for metallic and/or non-metallic structure preferred
Familiarity with MRB, structural testing, flight test, or analysis automation (e.g. Python programming or similar) preferred

Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background check. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other category or class protected under applicable federal, state or local law. Individuals with disabilities may request a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation at: ta-support@supernal.aero
This position may include access to certain technology and/or software source code subject to U.S. export controls laws and regulations. If an export authorization from an applicable US regulatory agency is required in connection with your employment, your employment is contingent upon Supernal’s receipt of such regulatory authorization(s) and your continued compliance with all conditions and limitations pursuant to such authorization(s).Base pay offered may vary depending on skills, experience, job-related knowledge and location. This position is also eligible for a bonus as part of total compensation.The pay range for this position is:$166,400—$232,960 USDClick HERE or visit: https://jobs.supernal.aero/benefits to view our benefits!
